website_summaries.verdict: The Jaybird Freedom is in many ways the best Jaybird headphone yet -- and a strong wireless in-ear sports headphone -- but a few design flaws and its high price tag spoil the package.
pros: The Jaybird Freedom has a slimmer design and offers a more comfortable fit than its predecessors
It offers excellent sound for an in-ear Bluetooth sports headphone, is sweatproof, and offers good battery life when you include the extra four hours you get from the included battery clip
cons: Inline remote is a little too heavy
if you lose the battery clip, you can't charge the headphones

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality headphones - great for sports use or when walking
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent quality headphones. The only downside I have noted for them is that if you mislay the bespoke charger, which I did for some time, then you are scuppered. Sound quality is excellent and they are comfortable to wear with a good range of earbuds. the charge doesn't last as long as I'd like but that's a common issue with bluetooth earphones.
customer_reviews.author: Purpleheart

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and useful in ear wireless ear phones
customer_reviews.author: BusyReader

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for runners
customer_reviews.text: Finally! A pair of wireless headphones that are comfortable to run with! I've tried so many pairs over the last couple of years but these are by far the best. Really easy to set up, lightweight and with lots of different sized ear cover things (not sure of the technical term) so you can make sure they fit your ears perfectly. They don't fall out - hooray - and are comfy too. It's so nice to run without worrying about a wire, and not to have to run holding my phone. Can't recommend them highly enough.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Marple

customer_reviews.title: Jaybird legacy is over under Logitech ownership
customer_reviews.text: Bought a pair of these in September. Babied them, wiped them clean after each workout and in 4 months they are already dead. First, the foam tips dried up and tore apart, then the earbuds died themselves. They are not holding any charge anymore. Jaybird would not even care to provide support to countries outside of their sales network. (I live in Turkey) In the old days of Jaybird Bluebuds X they would be shipping me a new pair in no time but now under Logitech's ownership Jaybird's support is pretty much deadbeat. Edit: They did accept sending me a replacement but only to a US adress, stating not having an international warranty.
customer_reviews.author: C. Gokceatam

customer_reviews.title: Great for small ears!!
customer_reviews.text: I can never find ear buds that will stay in my ears, especially for jogging/working out. These are perfect! They stay in, have a good battery life and very functional! Great product, and I'm so glad I found them, because I've tried so many kinds!
customer_reviews.author: Emilee

customer_reviews.title: Jay bird reset the their own bar!
customer_reviews.text: Love these. Sound quality is my biggest priority and the flexibility of the app to customize or choose a setting that someone else came up with is revolutionary. With sensitive ear cartilage the new soft tips are for me! The aerodynamic metal construction can boom it out or whatever your preference and give a real solid feel. And I can wear my snow gear tight over my ears. The X-1 and X-2 were phenomenal but the new freedom are definitely next level. My only drawback so it doesn't seem like I work for the company is the piggy back charger could be a little more aerodynamic. But we can save that for a later model. Lol.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: speaker cap fell off in the second day of use
customer_reviews.text: I am completely dissapointed with this earbuds because the problem that had my NEW headphones jaybird freedom, which acquired just two days ago and have already broken by the right earbud, as the speaker cap fell off the headset body exposing the cables and connections, I feel very disappointed because i trusted on the promotion they did and can not believe that with just two days of use it presented such damage level, I wrote to the jaybird customer support remaining attentive to their immediate response with the solution to my complaint.
customer_reviews.author: CarlosRM

customer_reviews.title: Would be nice if the control panel was located center
customer_reviews.text: One issue I find is that the left side tends to pull downward, due to the heavier control panel on the right-side. Would be nice if the control panel was located center. That way the plugs would set nicely along the back of the head
customer_reviews.author: bill calhoun

customer_reviews.title: Best jay birds so far for me
customer_reviews.text: This is probably my 5th pair of jaybirds (I have been using them for YEARS) but by far this are the most comfortable and best doing I ever had Love them
customer_reviews.author: Micaela Morcillo

customer_reviews.title: Color,battery life, sound quality great!
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, good for jogging, good sound. Charge last for about 3 hrs, plus battery pack gives another 3 hrs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer Mo

customer_reviews.title: Love them! Easy to use and sync with my ...
customer_reviews.text: Love them! Easy to use and sync with my HTC U11. I find it very practical for the gym. Sometimes I can have trouble when talking on the phone when there is too much noise around, so I prefer no to use these earplugs, instead I talk on the phone directly.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: ... a huge back step for Jaybird and I don't recommend it at all X models are much better than ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a huge back step for Jaybird and I don't recommend it at all X models are much better than freedom (It's really bad product with high price) and one of the biggest problem when you lost the USB special charger that means you can't use it any more not like X models.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmed M. Al-Ghamdi

customer_reviews.title: Defective Unit
customer_reviews.text: I got these headphone just the other day, and they worked perfectly for 2 days, on the third day I kept losing connection everywhere I went, even sitting in my room. Finally this morning the left ear stopped working. I hope this was just a defective unit and I can get it replaced, because the headphones really were nice
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good headphones.
customer_reviews.text: 2nd pair for my son. He loved the 1st pair and loves these.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene D Jackson

customer_reviews.title: i was the best ever santa
customer_reviews.text: gave 2 pair as gifts .wow.i was the best ever santa..they loved them. very active ladies who love.the app that you use to.enhance listening.so GLAD apples buds weren't ready.
customer_reviews.author: MIKE SMALTINI

customer_reviews.title: So far I have used two sets of these and ...
customer_reviews.text: So far I have used two sets of these and both started abruptly shutting off. The first set would shut off with no warning after 20 minutes. The second set is doing the same after 40 minutes. Both indicated a full charge before use. Zero confidence in Jaybird now.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon F Barricklow

customer_reviews.title: A VERY VERY GOOD BUY!
customer_reviews.text: Finally found the best running buds for me, fits me really well, easy to connect with your gadgets 😁 also very fast shipping!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Roselle Garcia

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Light, easy to use, and great looks are the ups. Downs are that the battery failed me twice within the first month already, tried to contact Jaybird, but no reply from email enquiry. Something of this cost should not break down within the first month. Service so far is one of the worse I've seen !
customer_reviews.author: FONG W. Chi Wai

customer_reviews.title: Mic kinda sucks so its bad for calls but they sound really ...
customer_reviews.text: Mic kinda sucks so its bad for calls but they sound really good after installing the app on your phone
customer_reviews.author: R. Wlliamson

customer_reviews.title: Small Ears & Happy!
customer_reviews.text: I have very small ears and workout for about 1.5 hours 3 times a week. I love these ear buds and the app controls.
customer_reviews.author: LF

customer_reviews.title: Product is superb in sound under its price range. ...
customer_reviews.text: Product is superb in sound under its price range. However, the included comfy foam only last for a month. Waiting for on shop replacement comfy foam to try.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy to listen to music!
customer_reviews.text: For phone use this product was fine, music on the other hand is horrible, even with the app! Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: After having for a few months they began randomly shutting off or disconnecting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sweet.
customer_reviews.text: Best headphones I've ever had. No doubt. Easy to misplace though.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Love the sound
customer_reviews.text: Love the sound. Love the ear options. My only complaint is that it pulls on my ears even it gets caught on the back of my shirt. Trying to find a comfortable fit without it being to right around my hair.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I've had other headphones that have fit better. I also experience the music cutting out
customer_reviews.text: I've had other headphones that have fit better. I also experience the music cutting out, I'm guessing due to the Bluetooth connection. It does it less when it's on the same side of the receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew W.

customer_reviews.title: Great earphones
customer_reviews.text: I totally love this product. It is the best pair of wireless earphones I have ever owned and the price was great! They are easy to use and program.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Blue ones don't have the comply foams included
customer_reviews.text: I've wanted the blue ones and when i saw they were 20 bucks lesser than the other colors i ordered them immediately. Amazing headphones. Very slick model. In fact even if you have them on and lie on a pillow on the side, you wont feel them. Kinda like the apple ear pods. But one thing really disappointed me was that when i opened the pouch i found some ordinary foams instead of the comply memory foams. But one can always order them separately to match the blue of the headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Mir Owais

customer_reviews.title: Love them. Best sounding wireless buds to day
customer_reviews.text: Love them. Best sounding wireless buds to day. Once you get the fit to your liking, you forget they are in your ears. Battery life not an issue for me. I replaced the earbuds with some sony hybrids that give better isolation and richer bass ( well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Mike S.

customer_reviews.title: Not What I expected!
customer_reviews.text: It's not what I expected. I had the Jaybird x2 before these and the were great but then they got stolen and I had to replace them and of course I would want to upgrade them to the better technology. Well the head phones themselves have an echo that I never heard with the x2 they also don't fit as comfortable as the x2 and the battery clip is so small and not easy to keep track on it makes me very frustrated. They don't even have a carrying box like the x2 but it has more things to loose. I wish I had my x2 back!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn White

customer_reviews.title: Best Bluetooth earbuds ibe used
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic wireless earbuds. Sound is great and they stay in my ear at the gym. This is my second pair of earbuds from this company and I have been very happy with both of them.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah C.

customer_reviews.title: Great sound & fit / awful charging concept
customer_reviews.text: The charging situation is absurd. I guess it's nice to have the option of the removable battery booster, but I've lost it more times than I've charged these things. The little dongle is tiny, but too heavy to realistically wear it in an athletic setting. It would be best to just leave the dongle plugged into one micro-usb cord, but that makes charging impossible in multiple locations. I have a micro usb at work, in my car & several at home. But I'm relegated to charging this headset where the dongle is. Luckily the battery life is long on these things because it's going to be a while before I find the charger again.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Edward Guenther

customer_reviews.title: Small buds for petite woman!
customer_reviews.text: My fiancee is a petite woman with small ears. We have tried many ear buds and after multiple tries and returns the Jaybird Freedom works very well for her. She is pleased with the sound quality and ease of connection to her phone. During her workouts no issues of falling out or slipping during various exercised. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Abe

customer_reviews.title: bad purchase decision
customer_reviews.text: mine shut itself down one or two minutes after i turn it on while the battery is still on 80% or full. but if i snap the charger to it, it will work fine. i also experience stutters sometimes. with a battery life so short, and now this problem, i think this is a very bad purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!!!
customer_reviews.text: Sooooo happy!!! Couldn't have found a better product! Exactly what I was looking for, small compact and extremely comfortable! Great clear sound! Great app too, if you wish to play with the acoustics. Loved mine so much I bought the X3's for my partner, he wanted something a little bigger in the ear but still comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Natswest

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: 6months in and they're not turning on anymore.. huge step back from Bluebuds X2.
customer_reviews.author: Carolina Varady

customer_reviews.title: In term of sound quality, isn't what I'm expecting ...
customer_reviews.text: In term of sound quality, isn't what I'm expecting for the price. It get muffled at 50% of volume In term of build. Is a solid built but since I've​ small ear canal. i can't get it to fit and it keep dropping out from the left ear due to the control.
customer_reviews.author: ZhaoYong

customer_reviews.title: This is the 3rd set of Jaybird headphones I've had ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd set of Jaybird headphones I've had and the 3rd set that have died right around the year mark. Not buying them again.
customer_reviews.author: Brian C. Hubbs

customer_reviews.title: these are by far the best to date
customer_reviews.text: I have owned the X1, X2 and now the Freedom F5's, these are by far the best to date! The new sound app is heaven sent!! I have been looking for a work around for the crappy EQ built into mobile devices and this is it!! I can also wear these under my motorcycle helmet!! I have never heard a better set of wireless headphones and I have tried many.
customer_reviews.author: James Escobar

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It was given as a gift and very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Nanc

customer_reviews.title: Product is junk. Nothing but issues... ...
customer_reviews.text: Product is junk. Nothing but issues... ear buds constantly falling off, speakers needed to be reset several times, cracked head phone. Customer service was little to no help. Just buy the Bose you originally planned on buying!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy B

customer_reviews.title: Jaybird x2 is Not working
customer_reviews.text: Recently bought this product from you right one earphone is not working please solve my problem
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Okay sound & not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: These are compact and seemingly durable earbuds. When you turn them on, they give you audio guidance for pairing, so they're fairly intuitive, and the instructions are clearly written. The app for your phone just provides an equalizer, but it's not really enough to make me want yet another app and login/profile with yet another device. For running, I highly recommend the silicone ear fins rather than the other tips that are provided since they're more secure. All that said, the earbuds are tiny and constantly feel like they're going to fall out. And the sound they provide is only so-so, not nearly what I'd expect for the price ($150 as of this writing).
customer_reviews.author: M. Gondek

customer_reviews.title: Bad for travel
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are perfectly fine if you are a person that is organized enough to store them in their case unless they are in your ears. Because if you do not properly store these headphones when not in use, you will lose parts/pieces. The silicone tips fall off/slip off of the headphones with the slightest tug or brush. Next will be the wings meant to secure the headphones in your ear. Oh and if the headphones aren't clipped onto your shirt, the heavy battery and controls will pull the headphones down the right side. All in all, they are a pain to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Yash G.

customer_reviews.title: as much as I wanted to love these, they were pretty frustrating overall
customer_reviews.text: Well, as much as I wanted to love these, they were pretty frustrating overall. They came with no charge at all and in order to charge them you have to use a special attachment and a special cord, instead of a simple mini USB like most products these days. Once charged, the sound is good, but not any higher quality as I thought it would be for the price. Overall, these were disappointing and there are better deals for your dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Hart

customer_reviews.title: (b) have amazing sound; (c) let me talk on my phone
customer_reviews.text: I have had many earphones for many different purposes. Now I have one for all purposes. These earphones: (a) stay in my ear; (b) have amazing sound; (c) let me talk on my phone; and (d) are a cool color. I like the additional ear foam and ear bud sizes sent along with the product – those are usually good backups to keep available. However, I’m still on my first foam pads, and the fit (into my especially large ear canal) is excellent. I use them at the gym, while running, and for telephone conversations. I do not have eardrum syndrome, and the fit is loose enough that it does not create any internal pounding in my ear canal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: which were great products as well
customer_reviews.text: The FREEDOM buds are small, but they provide BIG sound quality! I have previously used JayBird's BluebudsX as well as the X2 headphones, which were great products as well, but I will say these take the cake. The fit is secure // comfortable, which is a high priority for me since I am a triathlete and use them often while working out. The wireless feature is great in this realm as well .. especially when running both outside and on a treadmill. They sync easily to my bluetooth devices, and the battery life is as promised. Thumbs up on the hassle-free nature of this product and happy listening to all!
customer_reviews.author: Lesley Smith

customer_reviews.title: Appears to be improved over the older version of these headphones.
customer_reviews.text: Appears to be improved over the older version of these headphones. I really think that Jaybird would have done better if they had just made this version a new model number, but many of the complaints for the older version of the F5s are addressed. They don't fall out as easily, and the battery life is fine. My only complaint is that they could fit tighter in my ears, but that may just be my ears, and I haven't had problems with them falling out.
customer_reviews.author: Darren

customer_reviews.title: Trash Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Awful, paid a premium for these headphones and they didn't last a year. Now they wont even hold a charge. Favorite headphones when they worked and now support wont even send me a new pair without a receipt from when I bought them 8 months ago. The build quality of these seem solid when you first get them, but obviously there is a major flaw. Be sure to look up "Jaybird freedoms not charging" and see the never ending list of posts by people who have the same issue.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Hazimeh

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: Long lasting and durable. I use them all the time. Occasionally the ear bud pops off when they are rolling around in my purse. I've accidentally washed then in my jeans pocket and they still work well!
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Don't accept X2 "upgrade"
customer_reviews.text: Got these as an upgrade because my X2s broke. Don't accept the upgrade, these sound much worse than the X2s and can't reach as high of a volume. I would say these are not nearly as comfortable due to the controls being much bigger than they are in the X2. One plug always has weight on it and wants to fall out of my ear. If you have to get an "upgrade" due to broken X2s try and see if you can get the X3s, they might be better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Do not get this if you sweat.
customer_reviews.text: Initally when i got it, I was excited. The shop staff was raving to me how much he enjoyed it going to the gym and running. I took up his recommendation and bought this. For a few months, I enjoyed myself- Long Bluetooth range, good sound, Long runs with no wires, excellent gym workout.... Then it broke. One day, it completely stopped working. Jaybird refused to charge. Opened the set up to find water damage inside the remote. Evidently jaybird did a poor job of water protection. What use is it when it can't be used for sports and heavy sweating? Do not get this if you sweat.
customer_reviews.author: johnnyboys

customer_reviews.title: Good build quality. Great customer Service.
customer_reviews.text: Headphones are a solid headphone. The mic works great for calls. They hold a charge well and seem to take all the sweat I can dish out. The extra pieces are not the easiest to get used to hold the headphones in your ears and they are necessary for specific activities. While running the control unit is noticeable. I am looking forward to the truly wireless ones they have coming up. Had an issue with the cord on the initial pair. Customer Service replaced them with excellent service.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Junk. Broke at the earpiece.
customer_reviews.text: Junk. Bought these and they broke in a few months at the ear. Similar to a number of other people. All this companies headphones are made similarly. My last bluetooth headphones lasted 5 years. Never Jaybird again.
customer_reviews.author: BriB72

customer_reviews.title: This has been the worst pair of headphones I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This has been the worst pair of headphones I've ever owned. The sound quality is poor and when the volume is up loud its making a weird noise. I've had 10 dollar headphones that work better then these, what a joke! I don't even like beats but they are way way way better then this crap.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: I have went through two pairs of these and they ...
customer_reviews.text: I have went through two pairs of these and they keep malfunctioning from sweat I believe. They are not able to hold up to everyday use working out. Both pairs started malfunctioning after about 4 months of use. Earbud volume and sound quality would start to diminish, then the units would not take a charge, and finally they would just die.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Love the wireless jay birds first time trying them out especially wireless charger easy to carry in pouch they come in and charges quickly
customer_reviews.author: maria

customer_reviews.title: They older model was superior in every way
customer_reviews.text: They older model was superior in every way. These are less likely to stay in your ears and the volume knob/button is much larger than the previous model which is any annoyance while moving around.
customer_reviews.author: Colt Lugar

customer_reviews.title: User Friendly Rating Zero
customer_reviews.text: Bought the headphones and already having way too much trouble trying to set up and pair the device. The only instructions are on jaybirds site itself. Definitely not user friendly and poorly designed. Been at it for the last hour following their instructions on getting it to search for my device and it still hasn't. Returning these immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Arsikh Jawaid

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this product
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this product. I bought these as a gift for my wife, and within 3 months they wouldn't charge. Jaybird customer support was poor and slow. Find other headphones
customer_reviews.author: Arthur J. Canter

customer_reviews.title: Not Sweat-Proof
customer_reviews.text: If you are in need of BT headphones for workouts, these aren't them as they are not sweat-proof. I can not get through a 3 mile run without them powering off. The first pair I received from jaybirdsport could no longer be powered on after a single run. It appears both the ear pieces and control unit are susceptible to damage when getting wet, which of course will surely happen during a work out. I could elaborate on fit, connectivity, and sound but don't see the point as they completely fail in my intended purpose, headphones to be worn during runs. Go with the X2 if you need "workout" headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Sal

customer_reviews.title: Won't pair
customer_reviews.text: So far, I have not been able to pair these headphones. I've sent an email to support and hopefully will get some help there. Will of course update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Ursula

customer_reviews.title: The bluetooth signal was never very strong (unless I literally held my ipod in my hand) and they never held terribly well in the
customer_reviews.text: Really, just skip these. The bluetooth signal was never very strong (unless I literally held my ipod in my hand) and they never held terribly well in the ear. But the real problem is they begin to loose their ability to hold a charge rapidly and within a couple months they were non functional. One of the worst products Ive ever purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus R. Miller

customer_reviews.title: I really loved the X-2
customer_reviews.text: I had the Jaybird X-2 before the Freedom F5. I really loved the X-2, so my expectations where already high for the new Freedom. The most noticeable change from the X-2 are the much smaller ear bud. They are made of metal which which makes them feel much more durable. The smaller ear bud easily fits further down into the ear and therefore stays locked in place a lot better. Sound quality is amazing - just like the X-2. An added bonus is the free MySound App from Jaybird (...) that allows you to customize your own sound settings (base, treble, etc.)
customer_reviews.author: Solar Power

customer_reviews.title: The sound is fine but you literally cannot keep these in your ears
customer_reviews.text: The sound is fine but you literally cannot keep these in your ears. If you are a runner the one side is very heavy with the control panel and combo's of the different ear buds do not seem to help. They wiggle free quickly and once the heavy side is out it is over. Since they don't stay on well, once they are out of your ears, they fall to the ground in a race, it really throws off your pace. Also, I've lost my charger, which means these are useless since you can't purchase a new one and they don't use a standard charger like most headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Volume is uncomfortably loud
customer_reviews.text: Start up/start down audio is too loud. Additionally the volume adjustment on android is way to sensitive. at 20% volume it is too quiet. Then one tap of the volume button makes them too loud.
customer_reviews.author: kschmidty

customer_reviews.title: Great Connectivity
customer_reviews.text: Tried the rest. This is the only one that connects when my phone is in my back pocket and I have a coat on. Love’em.
customer_reviews.author: Albert M Ayala

customer_reviews.title: Great overall. The only problems are the tips
customer_reviews.text: Great overall. The only problems are the tips. Finding the right fit for both types of tips is difficult and it's too easy for them to pop off and get lost when handling.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It screams at you
customer_reviews.text: I was a big fan of the original BlueBuds X as well as the X2's, but these are worse in every way. When your battery gets down to 20 percent, the headphones will tell you. This might sound like a nice feature, but the voice is REALLY LOUD, even if you have the volume of the headphones themselves set to low. There's nothing worse than listening to an ambient track only for a disambodied voice to scream at you to charge the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan S. Towles

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is good but these are the worst fitting headphones I have ...
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is good but these are the worst fitting headphones I have ever purchased. The controller hangs and pulls on your right ear. So you use the wire clip to tighten it up and then every twist of your head pulls on the wire. The foam ear tips do not help. They also feel delicate. And the charging system SEEMS like a good idea... but then you have to haul that little charging system with you everywhere. I returned these after 1 week of trying to love them and got something with better engineering and simpler marketing (and half the price tag). Don't get sucked in by the pretty pictures and marketing.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A. Wallner

customer_reviews.title: if not better. So far really enjoying the upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I also own the X2. I think downsizing was a huge improvement. The sound quality is on par, if not better. So far really enjoying the upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: First time jawing jay birds
customer_reviews.text: They are good headphones just overpriced one negative thing is that if u loose the charging part the head phones are worthless
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: I can honestly say these headphones, and Jaybirds in general, are a huge disappointment. I barely got a few months out of these before they stopped working and refused to charge. I had the X2's before these and they didn't even last a year. Terrible quality overall. Will not be buying these again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small package huge power
customer_reviews.text: Tons of power for me super compact headphone would definitely recommend jaybird has outdone itself again
customer_reviews.author: PHIL PECORARO

customer_reviews.title: not through here but i bought them at best buy. I have been trying to charge them
customer_reviews.text: So i bought these, not through here but i bought them at best buy. I have been trying to charge them. The light turned green but it wont turn on. Not sure if the main battery is bad or simply not a great product....
customer_reviews.author: King Batman

customer_reviews.title: JayBird nailed the design and performance of the Freedom Wireless ...
customer_reviews.text: JayBird nailed the design and performance of the Freedom Wireless headphones. A huge improvement from the X2's while maintaining the ability to stay in your ear during the toughest workouts. A must buy headphone!
customer_reviews.author: Tcast

customer_reviews.title: Great improvement...
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I'm huge fan of Jaybird products, and these are by far the best thing they've released yet. These headphones are so much smaller than anything they've released - and than anything else out there! Sound is incredible and if they last as long as their other headphones these will be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Seevinck

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE my Jaybird Freedoms
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE my Jaybird Freedoms!! Seriously, I use them for every run. The sound is super clear, they stay put and they are so easy to use. I would definitely recommend these if you are wanting an awesome pair of wireless headphones to workout with!
customer_reviews.author: janae jacobs

customer_reviews.title: ... linked very quickly to my phone and provided some excellent sound quality
customer_reviews.text: The Freedom linked very quickly to my phone and provided some excellent sound quality. I really loved the variety of ear-buds and customizable fits. When you power these on a voice actually tells you how much battery power you have left--very cool!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound, Amazing look!
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly small and amazing sound! Good things do come in small packages. The new app integration is legit and a game changer for those that really enjoy their music. Well done Jaybird (again)!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great only for low intensity quiet environments
customer_reviews.text: Great earbuds for low noise low intensity workouts. I can't use for runs as they envariably fall out of my ear regardless of size tip or with/without fin. Maybe my ears are a funny shape or I sweat too much, but nothing Jaybird provides works. (Best solution for fit, in my opinion is Powerbeats 2). Fins are very poorly engineered and placement is more a guess than a solid easy fit. Also find volume is relatively weak and not made for noisy gym work or downtown (Chicago-due to traffic noise). Sound and app are great. Recommend for light workouts in a relatively quiet environment...but $200? At this price, I was looking for the perfect solution but not found here.
customer_reviews.author: Donbie

customer_reviews.title: Great all-purpose headphones!
customer_reviews.text: These are great buds, I couldn't praise them highly enough. Whether I'm sweating on a run, or freezing on the mountain—they stay in my ear, and the battery... the battery life is kind of scary-good to be honest. On the technical side, the lows that Jaybird managed to pack into these little buds are what I truly find most impressive, with excellent (and more expected) mids & highs too. As a Jaybird faithful, the Freedoms have only confirmed brand loyalty and I not only would, but do suggest them to friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Jaybird Freedom F5 In-Ear Wireless Bluetooth Sports Headphones – Secure Sports Fit – Tough All-Metal Design – Ocean
product_meta.description:
Color:Ocean| Style:Headset Only

Take control of your life with the Jaybird Freedom Wireless Headphones! This revolutionary set of wireless headphones combines cutting-edge engineering and technology with a sleek look and a host of useful features to bring your audio listening experience to the next level.

Jaybird combines style, comfort, and function in one package: the Freedom. Designed to be as small as possible without sacrificing style or features, these headphones are incredibly versatile and are ideal for both leisure listening and pumping you up during a workout. They are also great for business travelers who need to be constantly updated with the latest news without the hassle of wires and faulty connectivity. The in-ear speaker design has been significantly reduced by 20% and houses an enhanced 6mm driver for subtle lows and a booming bass. The smaller frame is more convenient to handle and offers a comfortable fit for different ear sizes. These earbuds can even be worn with helmets. The control panel features a raised button for easy access and intuitive controls. Take calls and adjust the volume without any hassle! The hydrophobic nano-coating also makes the whole earbud waterproof, preventing sweat, snow, and rain from affecting your sound quality!

A wide variety of customized fit options are already included inside the box. The patented silicone ear fins (S, M, L) securely keep the buds inside your ears or can be used to hang them over the top. Lift the cord off your neck for a comfortable workout experience! Also, the Comply memory foam ear tips are designed to provide maximum noise isolation and comfort. They lock in the earbuds for a super secure fit, whether you’re on a calm jog, riding an MTB trail, or rushing to your next big meeting.

Additionally, the MySound app allows you to tweak every aspect of your sound: from the rumbling lows to the sweetest highs! Customize every little detail with the easy-to-understand interface. Compatible with iOS 9+ and Android 4.4+, your customized presets are saved directly onto the Freedom buds, carrying over to any music device or streaming service/app you use. Listen the way you want to or discover how your favorite athletes and artists enjoy their music through their custom sound profiles. Also, the Multipoint feature allows you to simultaneously pair and connect the Freedom buds to two different Bluetooth devices. Listen to your music through your laptop while still answering calls on your phone with the bud controller. You can also share your music with your spotter or workout buddy, as two separate buds can connect to the same Bluetooth device, eliminating the need to share earphones. You can even connect to your smartwatch and leave your smartphone at home!

With the Jaybird Freedom Headphones’ on-the-go clip charger, you’ll be ready for any adventure. These earbuds are great for people with active lives or who just want a micro wireless headphone that works! The Freedom lets you do more of what you want to do.
feature_bullets: MICRO-SIZED METAL BUDS – The Freedom Headphones by Jaybird have sandblasted, injection-molded metal parts for premium comfort and fashion. The smaller housing doesn’t affect signal performance and can remove distortion, giving you crystal-clear audio wherever you go

UNIVERSAL SECURE FIT – The patented silicone ear fins securely attach to the top and back/lower surface areas of the ear for a snug fit, locking the earbuds in during workouts and intense physical activities

SWEAT-PROOF – Built to last with a sleek yet rugged design, the Freedom Wireless Headphones are great for sports, workouts, and all weather conditions. Their hydrophobic nano-coating will keep moisture away, whether it's sweat, rain, or snow
PERSONALIZED SOUNDS – The MySound App allows you to tweak and customize the sound of your Freedom headphones for a personalized experience, and save them for later as a profile
HASSLE-FREE CHARGING – With just 20 minutes of charging, you get an extra hour of playtime. With up to 8 hours of total battery life, you’ll never miss a beat!
